lead_paragraph: Some technology experts say two artists are overselling their prowess regarding the digital swiping of a bust of the queen at a Berlin museum.

headline.print_headline: Nefertiti 3-D Scanning in Germany Raises Doubts
headline.main: Nefertiti 3-D Scanning Project in Germany Raises Doubts

snippet: Some technology experts say two artists are overselling their prowess regarding the digital swiping of a bust of the queen at a Berlin museum.
abstract: Technology experts assert German artists Nora al-Badri and Jan Nikolai Nelles could not have created replica of ancient Egyptian bust in Neues Museum with low-end 3-D scanning device they claim to have used; suggest data, which artists released online so anyone with 3-D printer could make copy, may have come from museum's own files or scan of high-quality replica of artifact.
